name: Warner Bros. Pictures
description: One of the 'Big Five' American film studios, known for franchises like Harry Potter, DC Universe, and The Matrix.

name: Universal Pictures
description: Founded in 1912, Universal is one of the oldest film studios in the US, known for Jurassic Park, Fast & Furious, and classic monster films.

name: Paramount Pictures
description: The second oldest American film studio, famous for franchises like Mission Impossible, Star Trek, and Transformers.

name: Walt Disney Pictures
description: Known for family-friendly movies and animated classics, Disney owns Pixar, Marvel Studios, and Lucasfilm.

name: 20th Century Studios
description: Originally 20th Century Fox, now owned by Disney, it's known for movies like Avatar, Alien, and X-Men.

name: Columbia Pictures
description: A major studio owned by Sony, Columbia is known for franchises like Spider-Man, Men in Black, and Ghostbusters.

name: Sony Pictures Animation
description: A division of Sony Pictures, focused on animated movies like Hotel Transylvania, Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse, and The Emoji Movie.

name: Lionsgate Films
description: An American film studio known for blockbuster franchises like The Hunger Games, Twilight, and John Wick.

name: MGM Studios
description: Founded in 1924, MGM is known for the James Bond series, Rocky, and classic musicals like The Wizard of Oz.

name: DreamWorks Pictures
description: Founded by Steven Spielberg, Jeffrey Katzenberg, and David Geffen, known for live-action films and animation under DreamWorks Animation.

name: New Line Cinema
description: Originally an independent studio, now a Warner Bros. subsidiary, known for The Lord of the Rings and A Nightmare on Elm Street.

name: Focus Features
description: A subsidiary of Universal Pictures, Focus Features is known for art-house and independent films like Brokeback Mountain and Moonrise Kingdom.

name: A24
description: An independent film studio known for critically acclaimed films like Hereditary, Moonlight, and Lady Bird.

name: TriStar Pictures
description: A subsidiary of Sony Pictures, known for movies like Jumanji (1995), The Mask of Zorro, and Baby Driver.

name: Marvel Studios
description: A subsidiary of Disney, known for producing the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) with characters like Iron Man, Thor, and Captain America.
